definition.name: Build Jekyll for GitHub Pages
definition.description: A simple GitHub Action for producing Jekyll build artifacts compatible with GitHub Pages
definition.author: GitHub

inputs.name: source
inputs.description: Directory where the source files reside.

inputs.name: destination
inputs.description: Output directory of the build. Although it can be nested inside the source, it cannot be the same as the source directory.

inputs.name: future
inputs.description: Publishes posts with a future date. When set to true, the build is made with the --future option which overrides the future option that may be set in a Jekyll configuration file.

inputs.name: build_revision
inputs.description: The SHA-1 of the git commit for which the build is running. Default to GITHUB_SHA.

evidence.reasoning: This action is primarily focused on building Jekyll artifacts, which falls under the Build category, and it also involves preparing content for GitHub Pages, aligning it with Publishing.
